intro: Palhinhaea pungens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved palhinhaea, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pungent, serrated leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
